resources.string: This feature has not been implemented yet
This will permanently delete this row.
This project is hosted on GitHub: %1$s
You can report bugs, enhancement proposals and feature requests at the GitHub issue tracker: %1$s
Join the Nextcloud team on Transifex and help us to translate this app: %1$s
This application is licensed under the GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE v3+.
All further icons used by this app are %1$s made by Google Inc. and licensed under the Apache 2.0 License.
Please try to force close the app and restart it again. There might have been an incorrect connection to the Nextcloud app.
If the issue persists, try to clear the storage of both apps: Nextcloud and Nextcloud Tables to solve this issue.
The upgrade of the database failed. Please report the issue and clear the storage to use the app normally.
You can clear the storage by opening the app info and selecting Storage ‚Üí Clear storage.
It looks like you tried to trigger a synchronization without an internet connection.
Connection was refused, please check if your server is reachable via web browser.
Connection timed out, please check if you\'re connected to the internet. This may also happen when your server is busy.
If you have enabled the \"Sync only on Wi-Fi\" setting, you can only synchronize when you are connected to a Wi-Fi.
Something seems to be wrong with your Nextcloud app. Please try to force stop both, the Nextcloud app and the Nextcloud Tables app.
If force stopping them does not help, you can try to clear the storage of both apps.
There wasn\'t a response from your server in the given time. Please make sure your instance is running well.
Check your network connection. Sometimes toggling the mobile data or Wi-Fi off and on again can help.
The response of your server was not correct. Please check whether you can access the Tables app via web interface.
There is an issue with your Nextcloud setup. Please have a look into the server log files.
Please check whether your Nextcloud instance is not currently in maintenance mode.
Your Nextcloud instance has no free storage left. Please delete some files to sync your local changes into your cloud.
We need the following technical information to help you:

Your server did respond with a HTTP 302 status code, which implies, that you do not have installed the Tables app on your server or something is misconfigured. This can be caused by custom overrides in a .htaccess-file or by Nextcloud apps like OID Client.
You have insufficient permissions. Please check tables which are shared to you and have been changed recently.
We could not determine the version of the server side Tables app. Please make sure it is installed and enabled.
The account of your Nextcloud app might no longer be authorised.
The current user does not match the user we have in our database. If you are using LDAP on your Nextcloud instance, your Nextcloud app might have stored an old user ID.
We could not fetch the capabilities of your server. Please make sure your server is running well and other client apps are able to access Nextcloud.
An attachment could not be uploaded. Please try to share it on another way and let us know about this bug.
Something seems to be wrong with the certificate of the server. Please check all the accounts in the Nextcloud app for further information.
Please disable all battery optimisations for Nextcloud and the Tables app.
Your Nextcloud instance seems to be not reachable. Please check your internet connection and whether you are able to connect to your instance via browser.
The Tables Android app requires the Nextcloud Android app to be at least version 3.18.
Importing tables. This may take several minutes.
The value seems not to be a number
The value must be between %1$s and %2$s
The value must be at least %1$s
The value must be at most %1$s
Time must be provided for a DateTime field.
Reordering columns is an experimental feature which may have unintended side effects to other configurations of the columns of this table as well.
Editing columns is an experimental feature which may have unintended side effects to other configurations of this column as well.
Editing columns of type %1$s is not yet supported.
Please note that editing numbers is currently only possible in US format (use comma for thousand separators and a dot for decimal separator)
Unsaved changes have been detected. Do you want to discard or save them?
Paste link or type to search
